textos_fuente.text: Private Aviation Company | Tradewind Aviation A Presidential Temporary Flight Restriction (TFR) will be in place at White Plains (HPN) on Saturday, September 13th, from 8:30 to 17:00, and Sunday, September 14th, from 8:30 to 15:00. During these times, HPN will be closed to flight operations . For questions or assistance, please contact the Tradewind Service team at (203) 267-3305. Close Open Menu Tradewind Experience Private Scheduled Destinations Travel info Northeast Know Before You Go Caribbean Know Before You Go Southeast/Bahamas Know Before You Go Check flight status Get the App Book a flight 800-376-7922 Login My Tradewind (ticket book and private charter) Loyalty Program Login Manage My Booking Book Experience Private Scheduled Destinations Travel info Login My Tradewind (Ticket Book and Private Charter) Loyalty Program Login Manage My Booking 800-376-7922 Book a charter flight Book a scheduled flight About Us Since 2001, Tradewind has operated on the premise that every flight deserves the highest quality aircraft, crew, and service. Our Story Founded by aviation enthusiasts in 2001, Tradewind provides personal air travel—both private and scheduled service—throughout North America and the Caribbean. Tradewind is headquartered in Oxford, Connecticut with operational bases at Westchester County Airport in New York, Luis Muñoz Marin International Airport in Puerto Rico, and Witham Field in Stuart, Florida. With a fleet of 30+ Pilatus PC-12s, Tradewind is the market leader in regional air mobility, servicing luxury destinations such as Nantucket, Martha’s Vineyard, St Barths, Virgin Gorda, Tortola, Anguilla, and the Bahamas. Scheduled flights offer the comfort and convenience of a private charter for the cost of a single seat. In the US, scheduled flights are operated from the New York area to Nantucket and Martha’s Vineyard. Flights depart from private FBO terminals, providing efficient and seamless travel to our guests’ destinations. In the Caribbean, scheduled flights are operated between San Juan, St Barths, Anguilla, Antigua, Virgin Gorda, Tortola, and St Thomas. From Tradewind’s Southeast base in Stuart, Florida, scheduled flights operate to Marsh Harbour and North Eleuthera. Private service is operated in our fleet of Pilatus PC-12s, allowing guests to have control over their travel experience and fly on their own time. Our fleet allows guests to land at airports closer to their final destination, allowing them to maximize time doing what they love. Our client service team is happy to assist with every step of the journey, including custom catering, ground transportation, and more. We would welcome the opportunity to provide our personal level of service for your next journey. Feel free to contact us at any time to discuss your travel needs. We look forward to talking to you and welcoming you aboard! Voted Top U.S. Airline Readers’ Choice Awards Condé Nast Traveler For the past four years, Tradewind has been named in the Top 5 Best Airlines in the United States. Find out more here. Thank you to all who have taken the time to vote and support Tradewind over the years! Join Our Newsletter! Subscribe form Email Phone Receive important messages via SMS Additional terms and conditions By clicking ‘Subscribe’, you agree to receive information on news, events, promotions, and services at Tradewind. Locations Tradewind Aviation is a growing Part 135 commuter & on-demand operator with four bases offering private charter and scheduled service throughout the U.S. and Caribbean. Click the map to view more Leadership Team A company is nothing without its leaders. The Tradewind leadership team has 10 decades of experience in the private aviation and transportation industry and brings that expertise to Tradewind's daily operations. Eric Zipkin Co-Founder and Chief Executive Officer With over thirty years as a pilot, Eric is the founder of Tradewind Aviation. He began his aviation career as a charter sales representative for Westchester Air, eventually serving as a pilot, Director of Marketing, and General Manager. Prior to aviation, Eric developed residential and commercial real estate in southern New York and founded a successful e-commerce business. Eric holds a B.S. in entrepreneurial management and economics from the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania and an Airline Transport Pilot Certificate. Eric is also founder and President of the D-Day Squadron, a philanthropic organization dedicated to historic aircraft from World War II. David Zipkin Co-Founder and Chief Commercial Officer David is a founding member of Tradewind and is responsible for sales, marketing, and business development. Prior to Tradewind, David served as brand and product director with several leading online marketing services firms. David is an instrument-rated pilot and holds a B.S. in Finance and Management Information Systems from the University of Vermont. Adam Schaefer Chief Operating Officer With over 25 years as a certificated pilot Adam brings considerable experience to the Tradewind Aviation team. Adam graduated magna cum laude from Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University in 2003 with a Bachelors degree in Aeronautical Science. He currently holds an Air Transport Pilot certificate as well as an Airframe and Powerplant mechanic’s certificate. Adam’s experience prior to coming to Tradewind includes flight instructing in both land and sea planes. Elise Garofalo Chief Financial Officer Elise joined Tradewind as Chief Financial Officer in 2024 with over 20 years of senior leadership experience across multiple industries including technology, consumer goods, professional services, and industrial manufacturing. As CFO, Elise provides counsel on all financial, business, and operational aspects of Tradewind's growing business with a focus on increasing profitability and growth. Elise graduated summa cum laude from the University of Connecticut with a B.S., earned her M.B.A. from Vanderbilt University, and is a CPA. Adam Hohulin Senior Vice President of Operations A lifelong aviator, Adam became a pilot at the age of 16 and transformed his passion for aviation into a career. After earning a B.S. in Aeronautical Science with a minor in Air Traffic Control from Embry Riddle Aeronautical University, Adam has held various roles within the industry including Line Pilot, Instructor, Director of Operations, and Senior Vice President of Flight Operations. Adam has an ATP with a Type Rating in the EMB135/145 Jet. Kyle Haines Vice President of Maintenance Responsible for the maintenance of the Tradewind fleet and all technical flight operations, Kyle has been with Tradewind since 2004. Starting as an apprentice, he then became Director of Maintenance in 2009, before being promoted to Vice President of Maintenance in 2024. Kyle holds an Airframe and Powerplant Mechanic's Certificate and an Inspection Authorization Certificate, as well as a degree from the Stratford School for Aviation in Maintenance Technicians. Crist Stilianos Vice President of Human Resources & People Crist is responsible for all aspects of Tradewind's people including Human Resources, talent management, team member training & development, pilot training experience, compensation & benefits strategy. Prior to Tradewind, Crist held HR Leadership positions across the Retail and Financial Services sectors specializing in luxury retail. Crist holds a Bachelor’s Degree in Brain Behavior, Cognition and Neuroscience from the University of Michigan. Jen Lozada Vice President of Revenue As Vice President of Revenue, Jen is responsible for the Sales and Marketing teams at Tradewind. Jen has a B.A. in Communications and an M.B.A. in Transportation Economics from Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University. After 10+ years in the aviation industry, Jen has extensive knowledge on aircraft sourcing, vendor partnerships, global account management, client retention, and client experience. Paul Reilly Chief Pilot With over thirty years’ experience as a pilot, Paul’s aviation career began with a gliding license and an introductory flight through the British Air Training Corp in the 1970s. He graduated from Strode’s College in England and holds a U.S. Airline Transport Pilot Certificate. Paul joined Tradewind in 2011 as a part-time pilot, before his promotion to Chief Pilot in 2024. Ed Adduci Director of Maintenance With over 20 years in the aviation industry, Ed started with Tradewind in 2013 as an A&P Mechanic. He quickly rose to the HPN Base Supervisor, then Lead Supervisor of Maintenance, Assistant Director of Maintenance, and now Director of Maintenance. He graduated in 2013 with an Airframe and Powerplant Mechanics Certificate and a degree in Maintenance Technicians from The School of Stratford Aviation. His background includes valuable experience as an Aircraft Crew Chief in the United States Air Force, where he worked on F-15s and F-22s, and subsequent work in a turbine repair shop, rebuilding engines for the U.S. Navy. Michael Giovannini Director of Safety Michael joined Tradewind as Director of Safety in 2024. He holds both a BS in Aviation Technology and MS in Student Personnel Administration from the University of Central Missouri. Michael has over 20 years of aviation experience, including his time as an Army pilot and previous Director of Safety roles for helicopter air medical transport companies and fixed-wing part 121 and 135 operations. Michael's qualifications are further highlighted by his Helicopter Commercial and Instrument ratings, as well as various certifications in aviation safety management, OSHA, and aviation accident investigation. Quinn Gladu Director of Customer Service Quinn joined Tradewind in 2023 as Director of Customer Service and is responsible for the owner services, scheduled services, and client services teams. Quinn’s expertise in data-driven decision-making paired with her extensive background in strategic implementation targets improves the overall Tradewind client experience. Blake Edwards Director of Scheduling and Dispatch Now Director of Scheduling and Dispatch, Blake started with Tradewind as a Charter Sales Representative in 2012. He has also worked as a Dispatch Supervisor and Charter Department Advisor for Tradewind. Blake holds a Bachelor of Science in Aviation/Air Traffic Management and an Associate degree in General Aviation Operations from Daniel Webster College. Blake has over a decade of experience in the aviation industry. Grace Richardson Director of Sales Operations Grace started with Tradewind in 2014 as a Marketing Administrator and advanced to Director of Marketing, where she led the department for 10 years with over a decade of industry experience. Her in-depth knowledge of the company and longstanding commitment have since led to her transition to Director of Sales Operations, where she now oversees sales and service processes, opportunities, performance, and technology. Grace graduated from Mount Ida College in 2010 with a Bachelor of Science in Hotel & Tourism Management. Lindsay Tokarz Director of Marketing Lindsay joined Tradewind in 2025 as Director of Marketing, bringing over 15 years of experience in the marketing industry, where she managed high-profile accounts for premium spirit brands. She holds a B.A. in Communications – Advertising from Marist College and is an expert in digital marketing, experiential activations, and client relationship management. Her strategic leadership and commitment to flawless execution bring exceptional value to the Tradewind team. Matthew Chernesky Director of Technology Solutions Matthew joined Tradewind in 2024 as the Director of Technology Solutions. He holds a bachelor's degree in Information Technology with a specialization in Network Administration from the University of Hartford. He began his career at a small MSP, advancing from a helpdesk technician to Technical Operations Manager. He then spent a decade in the BioTech field, rising from Network Engineer to Senior Director, where he grew his team and built IT and security programs for a large international organization. Ashley Nelson Financial Controller With over a decade of financial experience, Ashley joined Tradewind in 2013 as a Staff Accountant, before quickly advancing to Accounting Manager and now Financial Controller. Ashley’s responsibilities include overseeing Tradewind's Accounting and Finance teams. Ashley holds a Bachelor’s degree in Agricultural Business Management from SUNY Cobleskill. Maria Brinkmann Senior Manager of HR & Talent Operations With over 20 years of HR experience, Maria is the Senior Manager of HR & Talent Operations for Tradewind Aviation. Before starting with Tradewind in 2014, Maria attended Albertus Magnus College for Business Administration, and worked within the Non-Profit, Finance, and Insurance industries. X Regular commuters benefit from significant savings by purchasing ticket books, starting with 10 tickets. Additional benefits include ease of booking and flight management through the My Tradewind mobile app, and access to the automated waitlist system. Ticket books are available on Nantucket and Martha’s Vineyard routes. Click here to login or create a ticket book account. or Click here to continue your search. Island Grand at TradeWinds RumFish Beach at TradeWinds 5500 Gulf Blvd., St. Pete Beach, FL 33706 Call Resort: 727.367.6461 Fax: 727.363.2275 Toll Free Reservations: 6000 Gulf Blvd., St. Pete Beach, FL 33706 Call Resort: 727.360.5551 Fax: 727.363.2367 Toll Free Reservations: Subscription Details Your Information * First Name: * Last Name: * Email: * Country: Subject Select Subject Make Selection Date change to existing reservation made on website Rate inquiries Package inquiries Group reservations Questions about reservations made on a dot.com or third-party website All other reservation inquiries Comments Your Comments Submit Form Reservations © 2025 TradeWinds Resort Facebook Instagram TikTok YouTube Pinterest Blog RumFish Beach at TradeWinds 6000 Gulf Blvd, St Pete Beach, FL 33706 727.360.5551 Island Grand at TradeWinds 5500 Gulf Blvd, St Pete Beach, FL 33706 727.367.6461 About Us Contact Us Resort Policies FAQs Awards Media Center Accessibility Careers Travel Agents Jacaranda Owners Jacaranda Villas Privacy Policy Blog Site Map Terms of Use close menu Previous Next Island Grand at TradeWinds is the perfect place for your entire crew to just let go and enjoy all the sun and fun Florida has to offer. Parents can relax alongside the soft white sands and warm Gulf waters of St. Pete Beach while kids take advantage of the five pools, kayaking, paddleboarding, high-tide water slide, craft classes, and so much more! There's also kids camps with dedicated programming for ages 5-12. Kids will love to splash and bounce on the floating water park or fly thru the sky on a parasail! With so much recreation, you will need to take time and refuel. Island Grand has an extensive array of options, from grab and go to al fresco dining at Palm Court Italian, where classic red-sauce cuisine and fine wine come together for a welcoming dining experience. Explore Island Grand Book Island Grand now Resort Amenities 28 Beachfront Acres 5 Pools, 350 Beach Loungers 3 Story Waterslide Waterway Paddleboats 381 Rooms + Villas Floating Water Park Multiple Restaurants + Bars Contact details 5500 Gulf Blvd, St Pete Beach, FL 33706 Reservations: 800.360.4016 close menu Previous Next For the love of sand and surf from paddle boarding, snorkeling, and dolphin cruises, to beach fun and sun-kissed sunsets, RumFish Beach is the ultimate aquatic oasis. Dive into our coastal-inspired accommodations located gulf front on the awarding winning shoreline of St. Pete Beach. Grab your flip-flops and head to our adult only pool or the SandBar Patio and unwind while sipping on tropical beach drinks, and listening to gulf coastal vibes, while cozied up to an open fire table. From sunup to sunset, beauty and saltwater adventures are never-ending. It gets even better at the extraordinary RumFish Grill®, the ultimate under-the-sea dining experience. Dine on Florribbean cuisine with an emphasis on fresh ingredients and medley of spices and island fruits. Inside their massive retail shop, you will find brands like Salt Life, Maui Jims, and a large selection of al-lure-ing jewelry, sportswear, nautical art, and items suited for island life. In the seaside bars of ports of call throughout the islands, under slow-turning fans and over cool drinks, an idea began to take shape in the sailors’ minds: a lounge, back home in St. Augustine, that would recall the easy grace, the fun, the exotic charm of the island bars they visited. On their voyages, the two sailors collected and shipped home many of the ... view more » Years ago, a couple of merchant marine sailors found themselves far from their Florida homes, sailing in the South Sea Islands. In the seaside bars of ports of call throughout the islands, under slow-turning fans and over cool drinks, an idea began to take shape in the sailors’ minds: a lounge, back home in St. Augustine, that would recall the easy grace, the fun, the exotic charm of the island bars they visited. On their voyages, the two sailors collected and shipped home many of the artifacts — among them the solid teak bar, the grinning idol that squats on the back bar, the bamboo that adorns the “Dai Bar” — that decorate the lounge today. Even Trade Winds’ main trademark, and what people remember the most, the “Tropical Storm,” complete with lightning and thunder, echoes the island storms those two sailors heard so many years ago. In the beginning, there was a wonderful Minorcan restaurant owned by Ms. Clara Meir, where as early as 1944, Granville Grissom and Sterling Andrews helped lay the groundwork for what was to become the lounge. With much anticipation on February 20, 1945, John Meigs and Kenneth Dow opened the South Seas Lounge. Two years later, John Meigs had left, and on March 14, 1947, William S. Mills became Kenneth Dow’s partner. In the spring of 1949, C.F. Fisher and E.R. Carr bought the lounge and on May 17, 1954, sold the business to Rex Clark and Elizabeth Leonard Clark, the first of the Leonard family to own the business. After Rex Clark passed away, while sitting on an end stool at the bar, Betty sold the lounge to Theodore Webber on April 25, 1957. The business came back to the Leonard family when Walter “Duke” Leonard bought the lounge on April 5, 1961. While located at 1 Aviles Street in the early 60s, the Trade Winds began to establish itself as the place in St. Augustine to hear music. With the wonderful black pianist Amye playing “Stormy Weather” to lead into its trademark “Storm,” such well-known folk acts as Gamble Rogers , Jim Ballew, the Infamous Art Shill, and the Folksters with Nigel Pickering and Paul Champion, and many others played to enthusiastic crowds. If you were looking for good music and good times in the early 1960s, Duke’s Trade Winds was definitely your port of call. In 1964, the city’s historical restoration department unearthed the site of a hospital that dated back to the founding of St. Augustine, necessitating a relocation of the Trade Winds. With the change in location to the bar’s present address at 124 Charlotte Street came a change in the music. Soon the earlier folk acts were being followed to the Trade Winds’ stage by musicians such as Jimmy Buffet , the First National Rotagilla Band, Bob and Joline Patterson, John Westbrook, Don and Barry Dunaway, the Peyton Brothers, the Sounds of Blue Grass, and Odetta. On July 1, 1971, Duke sold the lounge to the then Toni Johnson. When they married on June 1, 1974, the Leonard name returned once again to Trade Winds. Duke Leonard was much more than just the bar’s owner; he was a truly colorful character, admired by men and loved by women. Duke always had a friendly word for his customers, an outrageous tale for his friends, or a liars’ poker game going at the bar. His passing on June 21, 1978, left a big void in the lives of his family and many friends. But Duke will always be remembered because even today his stories — and stories about him — are told over and over at the Trade Winds. In 1979, Toni hired Frank Garrison as the bar’s manager. It was Frank’s idea to bring in the likes of Doc Watson, the Platters, the Coasters, the Byrds, and Phil Driscoll, and so once again the music changed. At that time, Trade Winds was closed on Sundays, except for the parties on Palm Sunday and Easter Sunday. Frank said, “Let’s try opening on Sundays.” The idea was a success and now Trade Winds is open 365 days a year. As times changed, so did the music, and it began booking bands like Matanzas, Those Guys, Red River Band, Hooch, Spanky, Lisa and the Madhatters, and Blistur; acts that complete the evolution from the early days as a folk lounge to the current mix of the best music — rock’n’roll, blues, a little country, an occasional oldies act — in North Florida. For the past decade, Troy Locke and Matanzas have been the Winds house band playing nightly, Sunday through Thursday. Colleen Murphy keeps alive the idea of giving musicians a place to try out their act on Thursday’s Open Mic night. Mark Hart has put the ‘happy’ back in Happy Hour from 5-8  PM on Saturday through Wednesday. Janet Leonard now owns the Trade Winds Lounge, assisted by a staff that would make old Duke proud. It is said his ghost is seen wandering through the lounge, keeping a watchful eye on things. This generation at the Trade Winds Lounge is dedicated to continuing its tradition of having the VERY BEST LIVE ENTERTAINMENT in North Florida. View less HOURS: Open Daily from 11 AM - 2 AM LOCATION Address : 124 Charlotte Street, St. Augustine, FL 32084 Full map and directions Nearby Events Ancient City Poets at Sing Out Loud Presented by Ancient City Poets at Spinster Abbott's Sep 13, 2025 Facebook Twitter Linkedin Spill the Tea: Fresh-Brewed Comedy Presented by Third Space Improv at Third Space Improv Sep 13, 2025 Accessibility Info Facebook Twitter Linkedin TICKETS / REGISTRATION Lenny Foster: The Magnolia Season Presented by Lightner Museum and Lenny Foster's Gallery One Forty Four at Lightner Museum Jun 6 - Sep 14, 2025 Accessibility Info Facebook Twitter Linkedin Comedy Smackdown Presented by Third Space Improv at Third Space Improv Sep 19, 2025 Accessibility Info Facebook Twitter Linkedin TICKETS / REGISTRATION St. Augustine Book Festival Presented by Ximenez-Fatio House Museum at Ximenez-Fatio House Museum Sep 20, 2025 Facebook Twitter Linkedin SHOW MORE FIND LOCAL BUSINESSES Search by Keyword Select Category Drinks Places To Stay Restaurants Select Location Armstrong Crescent Beach Elkton Fruit Cove Hastings Palm Coast Palm Valley Ponte Vedra Ponte Vedra Beach St. Augustine St. Augustine Beach St. Augustine Shores Switzerland Vilano Beach SEARCH RESET DIRECTORIES Artist Profiles Restaurants Drinks Places To Stay Organizations Venues RESOURCES Spotlight Media Marketing Toolkit Most Viewed Events Stories SUBMIT A LISTING Event Organization Artist Profile ABOUT US Contact Us About Us Support the Arts ST. About Us – Trade Winds Citrus MENU MENU Home WHO WE ARE About Us Tru-Diversification Our Juices Tru-Juice Chilled Tru-Juice Tetra Freshhh Chilled Freshhh Tetra Squeezz Calico Jack Agriculture Production Facility Quality Systems News & Updates Our Brands Tru Juice Freshhh Squeezz Calico Jack Tru-Shake Tru-Almond Tru-Moo Tru-Milk Contact Us Trade Winds Citrus Limited is a truly authentic Jamaican company. Located in Bog Walk, St. Catherine, we pride ourselves with sharing and producing the BEST authentic Jamaican beverages that reflect the diversity of our people and our culture. © 2018, TradeWinds Citrus About Trade Winds Citrus Trade Winds Citrus Limited (TWCL) is a privately owned, limited liability Jamaican company located in Bog Walk, St. Catherine. TWCL is a manufacturing and distribution company with Wisynco Group Limited as a partner and primary distributor. Nestled in over 4000 acres of rolling countryside, TWCL prides ourselves on producing some of the best authentic Jamaican beverages that reflect the diversity of our people and culture. TWCL has a variety of brands, juices and flavours to suit our consumers desires for every occasion. Our brands include Tru-Juice, Freshhh Juice Drinks, Squeezz Fruit Drinks, Wakefield Juices and Calico Jack Rum Punch. Tru-Juice is the flagship brand of TWCL. Our juices are made from the finest fruits and vegetables produced locally and internationally and blended to perfection to provide the best products for you. We bring to you No Sugar Added 100% Juices and the taste of traditional homemade Jamaican juices without the hassle of preparing it yourself. Our History It all started with United Estates Limited (UEL), an Industrial and Provident Society registered on August 1982 with offices located at Bybrook, United Estates Limited (UEL), was officially registered on August 1982. UEL begun with offices located at Bybrook, Bog Walk in the parish of St Catherine, Jamaica. UEL had its focus on being an agro-industrial enterprise complete with agricultural lands and a processing facility. However in 2001, came the birth of Trade Winds Citrus Limited and with it the creation, implementation and subsequent expansion of the Tru-Juice Premium Quality and Freshhh Fruit Drinks brands in addition to the long standing focus on the growth of healthy crops of the previously known UEL. Important milestones and achievements over the years are listed below: 1982 Business acquired by the McConnell family 1982 1982 – Mainly a sugarcane farm, small acreage of citrus 1983 Citrus exports began to the USA due to a freeze of citrus crop in FL 1985 Another freeze took place in the FL and TWCL decided to go heavy into citrus 1986 TWCL started to convert sugarcane to citrus 1988 Jamaica Exporters Association - Member J$10M Exporters Club 1988 Modern Fresh Fruit Packaging System installed 1989 JAMPRO Award - National Champion Exporter (Fresh Foods) 1990 JAMPRO Award - Champion Export Farmer (National) 1991 Jamaica Exporters Association - Member J$20M Exporters Club 1991 Juice extractors installed 1991 Jamaica Exporters Assoc. - Distinguished Performer - Agro-Industry 1991 JAMPRO Award - Champion Export Farmer (National) 1992 Jamaica Exporters Association - Member US$1M Exporters Club 1992 Jamaica Exporters Association - Member JS$45M Exporters Club 1992 JAMPRO Award - Champion Export Farmer (National) 1992 Evaporator for concentrate plant installed 1993 JAMPRO Award - Champion Export Farmer (National) 1994 Governor General Award for Excellence in Exports 1995 Jamaica Exporters Assoc. - distinguished performer - Agro-Industry 1995 Jamaica Exporters Association - Champion Exporter Award 2001 Trade Winds Citrus Limited (TWCL) established 2013 Partnership/merge with Wisynco 2014 Tetra Pak Line1 commissioned to produce 200ml sizes 2015 Installation of Gable Top Filler 2016 Irrigation installed in citrus 2016 First time ever JEA Agri Champion 2016 PET Packaging developed 2017 Tetra Pak Line 2 commissioned to produce 500ml and 1L sizes 2018 Citrus greenhouse installed to accelerate planting © 2023, TRADE WINDS CITRUS

Home - Our Trade Services - Trade Winds Group Skip to content Trade Winds Group 413-478-5475 chip@tradewindsinc.com George & Co. NACVA IBBA 413-478-5475 chip@tradewindsinc.com Home Exit Planning Value & Profit Building Business Transitioning Business Valuation Due Diligence Consulting Consultation Contact Trade Winds Group Trade Winds Group, (TWG) was formed in 2002 by current President & CEO Chip Emerson. Chip has held executive leadership positions with global manufacturing companies including Parker Hannifin and Teleflex and has owned, operated and divested plastic injection molding and cnc machining businesses. Chip has incorporated 50 years of experiences and successes including “lessons learned, best practices and years of successful business acumen” into TWG. Each of these have resulted in the development and implementation of the core advisory services of which include: Exit Strategy &Transition Planning, Business Valuation, Transaction Brokerage for the Sale and Purchase of Privately Owned Businesses, Due Diligence Services and Value & Profit Building advisory and consulting services. While no two consulting engagements or business transactions are the same, TWG provides consistency with our fiduciary responsibility, confidentiality of information and our advisory expertise to our clients. Our time-tested and proprietary processes establish clear goals and objectives of which empower and drive dynamic and favorable client outcomes. Unlike other business advisory firms, we position ourselves as an extension of our clients rather than being a third party. We are not just about billable hours and closing deals, we are about creating long-term sustainable value for our clients. We tell it like it is and are never afraid to pull the plug on an engagement or transaction if it is just not right. Our Time-Tested Services Exit Strategy and Transition Planning Value & Profit Building Services Business Transitioning & Transaction Services Business Valuation Services Due Diligence Consulting Services Why do I need a business valuation? A business valuation is an essential part of running a business. Sooner or later every business owner will need to know the current value of the business. Trade Winds Group will prepare and present an independent, third party report for a variety of end uses including, but not limiting the following purposes: The sale or acquisition of a business An exit strategy, transition plan Obtaining new financing Valuing intellectual property or a product-line Buy/sell agreements Trade Winds Group Provides Unparalleled Service & Expertise: Corporate Executives Small Group Buyers Private Equity Groups Public Companies Industry Companies Synergistic Buyers High Net Worth Buyers George & Co. Book Now Close Select the dates of your stay Stay Dates Check-In 18/02/1986 Check-Out Sun Mon Tue Wed Thu Fri Sat Previous month Next month Reset Calendar Close Select the Number of guests & room for your stay Guest Decrease 1 Increase Children Decrease 0 Increase Rooms Decrease 1 Increase Close Enter your group code or promo code below Code Type Select Code Type Promo Group Agent ID Code I don’t have one RESERVATIONS 800.360.4016 Close Home / About Us About Us The Story Behind Your Stay TradeWinds Resort includes Island Grand at TradeWinds, the largest beachfront resort in St. Pete Beach, and RumFish Beach at TradeWinds, home of the popular RumFish Grill restaurant. The properties function as two independent hotels, with the “stay at one, play at two” concept. New investment capital provided additional resources to further enhance the resort’s widespread appeal and positioned TradeWinds as one of the top beach resorts in the country, focusing on the needs of its consistent and loyal customer base. Sustainability The hotels have long been a friend of the environment, and have been awarded the Florida Green Lodging certification by the Florida Department of Environmental Protection for protecting the area’s natural resources, reducing waste, and minimizing pollution. They were the first hotels on St. Pete Beach to plant sea oats, which help prevent erosion and to install turtle-friendly amber lighting on the beachfront. The TradeWinds EcoTeam raises awareness about the effects of the human footprint. They hold beach cleanups and bring in guest speakers to educate employees, guests, and local residents. Learn more about our green efforts . Community Involvement At TradeWinds Resort, we specialize in making people feel at home. That’s why we’re committed to helping those around us who could use a hand making their home in our community. We constantly look for new opportunities to become involved in the lives of those around us. Please contact us if you’d like to discuss a way in which we can help your charitable organization. Here are some of our many community involvement programs: TradeWinds’ employees are given the opportunity to volunteer their time with Tampa Bay Watch to help rebuild oyster shell reefs similar to natural oyster communities found along the shoreline of Tampa Bay. Two TradeWinds employees founded the Eco Team , which raises awareness about the effects of the "human footprint" through monthly meetings with guest speakers from local organizations such as Tampa Bay Watch, Sea Turtle Trackers, and Clearwater Marine Aquarium. The team also participates in monthly beach cleanups and adopts Sea Turtle nests every year. Parents can relax alongside the soft white sands and warm Gulf waters of St. Pete Beach while kids take advantage of the five pools, kayaking, paddleboarding, high-tide water slide, craft classes, and so much more! There's also kids camps with dedicated programming for ages 5-12. Kids will love to splash and bounce on the floating water park or fly thru the sky on a parasail! With so much recreation, you will need to take time and refuel. Island Grand has an extensive array of options, from grab and go to al fresco dining at Palm Court Italian, where classic red-sauce cuisine and fine wine come together for a welcoming dining experience. Explore Island Grand Book Island Grand now Resort Amenities 28 Beachfront Acres 5 Pools, 350 Beach Loungers 3 Story Waterslide Waterway Paddleboats 381 Rooms + Villas Floating Water Park Multiple Restaurants + Bars Contact details 5500 Gulf Blvd, St Pete Beach, FL 33706 Reservations: 800.360.4016 close menu Previous Next For the love of sand and surf from paddle boarding, snorkeling, and dolphin cruises, to beach fun and sun-kissed sunsets, RumFish Beach is the ultimate aquatic oasis. Dive into our coastal-inspired accommodations located gulf front on the awarding winning shoreline of St. Pete Beach. Grab your flip-flops and head to our adult only pool or the SandBar Patio and unwind while sipping on tropical beach drinks, and listening to gulf coastal vibes, while cozied up to an open fire table. From sunup to sunset, beauty and saltwater adventures are never-ending. It gets even better at the extraordinary RumFish Grill®, the ultimate under-the-sea dining experience. Dine on Florribbean cuisine with an emphasis on fresh ingredients and medley of spices and island fruits. Inside their massive retail shop, you will find brands like Salt Life, Maui Jims, and a large selection of al-lure-ing jewelry, sportswear, nautical art, and items suited for island life.
